skill.name: waterfall-development
skill.description: Enforces strict waterfall development workflow with phase gates. Use when (1) features.yml exists in project root, (2) user asks to implement/develop/build a feature, (3) user explicitly requests waterfall workflow. Creates features.yml if missing when invoked.
skill.summary: Enforces strict waterfall development workflow with phase gates. Use when (1) features.yml exists in...
skill.author: Chemiseblanc

security_audit.summary: Pure validation tool with no network access, no external command execution, and limited filesystem access to only a features.yml file. Behavior matches stated purpose of phase gate enforcement.

content.value_statement: Managing software projects without structured phases leads to missed requirements and incomplete features. This skill enforces five mandatory gates that prevent progress until each phase meets defined criteria, ensuring disciplined waterfall development.
actual_capabilities: Validates five phase gates before transitions
Checks requirements have descriptions and proper status
Verifies test coverage and test passing status
Blocks work that does not match current phase
Creates features.yml when missing via feature-file skill
Supports validation of specific features or all features
limitations: Only supports five fixed phases (Requirements ‚Üí Design ‚Üí Implementation ‚Üí Testing ‚Üí Complete)
Does not execute code or modify files beyond validation
No bypass mechanism for gate failures

use_cases.title: Enforce governance
use_cases.description: Prevent teams from advancing phases without completing required artifacts and reviews

use_cases.title: Validate test coverage
use_cases.description: Ensure every requirement has corresponding tests before allowing Complete phase

use_cases.title: Structure new features
use_cases.description: Guide teams through disciplined waterfall phases with clear entry criteria

prompt_templates.title: Check status
prompt_templates.prompt: Run phase gate validation for the [feature name] feature

prompt_templates.title: Advance phase

prompt_templates.title: Audit all
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all phase gates for all features in this project

output_examples.input: Validate if my feature can transition to Testing
output: Cannot advance to Testing phase until all gate requirements are met.

best_practices: Define requirements with descriptions before attempting Design phase
Document architectural decisions before starting Implementation
Update requirement status to In-Progress when work begins
Link tests to requirements using tested-by field
anti_patterns: Advancing to Testing without test coverage
Setting requirements to Complete without verification

faq.question: What is the waterfall development model?
faq.answer: A linear, sequential approach with distinct phases: Requirements, Design, Implementation, Testing, and Complete.

faq.question: What happens if a gate fails?
faq.answer: The skill prints gate failures and stops execution. You must fix all failures before the phase transition is allowed.

faq.question: Can I skip phase gates?
faq.answer: No. There is no bypass mechanism. All gate criteria must pass before advancing to the next phase.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only validates the features.yml file. It does not execute or modify your source code.

faq.question: What is features.yml?
faq.answer: A YAML file that defines features, requirements, decisions, and test cases for tracking waterfall project progress.

faq.question: How is this different from agile?
faq.answer: Waterfall requires completing all artifacts for one phase before starting the next. Agile allows iterative work across phases simultaneously.
